contents.markdown:
# The Barber of Seville

by Gioachino Rossini

January 20, 22, 23*, 26, 28*, 29, 1983

An Opera in three acts;
Libretto by Cesare Sterbini after Beaumarchais' play of the same title.
Premiered in Rome, February 20, 1816.

English Translation by Ruth and Thomas Martin


## CAST IN ORDER OF APPEARANCE

Fiorello, servant of Count Almaviva
Count Almaviva
Figaro, a barber
Rosina, ward of Dr. Bartolo
Dr. Barolo, a physician
Ambrogio, servant of Dr. Bartolo
Berta, housemaid of Dr. Bartolo
Don Basilio, a music master
Sergeant

TOM TIVNAN
EDUARDO GIMENEZ/ABRAM MORALES+
TIMOTHY NOLEN/ERICH PARCE

JUNE ANDERSON+/MARY LOGAN HASTINGS
MICHAEL LI PAZ+/ARCHIE DRAKE

OSBORN MOE

SHIRLEY HARNED
NOEL MANGIN, O.B.E.
RICHARD VALE

Serenaders and Soldiers

Conductor
HENRY HOLT
Stage Director
JAMES LUCAS
Stage Manager
MICHAEL MITCHELL
Chorus Preparation
Scenic Design
Costuming Design
Lighting Design
E. DEE TORREY
WAYNE GEROU
BARBARA MURPHY-YORK

REBECCA WAKEFIELD/MARK MOORE

ERCOLE SORMANI
SEATTLE OPERA ASSOCIATION

Hairstyles and Wigs
Make-up

*Opera-in-English series
+Seattle Opera debut

8:00 CURTAIN

Final Curtain for The Barber of Seville approximately 11:00 p.m.
Latecomers will not be seated after the house lights are lowered.
There will be two intermissions.
